jobDescription: About ShiftWe believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. Weve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process.And we arent stopping there. We aim to bring that same transparency and convenience to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At Shift, were building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go.Shift is bringing transparency and trust to the used car industry. Data is core to this transformation: from building best-in-class pricing, to loan decisioning, to logistics optimization, to in-product recommendations. If youre passionate about using data to fix an enormous, antiquated industry, youll fit right in.We are seeking a Data Analyst to help us improve our business by performing analysis to support strategic decision making, managing reporting, and work closely with our engineering and data science team to build data pipelines and models. The ideal candidate is highly motivated, committed to learning and personal development, and adaptable to a fast pace environment. The candidate will apply strong business judgement and technical skills to derive valuable insights from data. This is the perfect opportunity for someone with 1-4 years of work experience in an analytical role to gain valuable experience at a high-growth, mobile commerce start-up.The person in this role will have the opportunity to work on analytics problems cross-functionally. In a new product roll-out, they might be tasked with developing a go-to-market strategy or partnering with engineers and product managers to ensure the launch is measurable. In scoping a new pricing structure, they might be tasked with forecasting the impact on our bottom line and providing recommendations on how to modify our pricing algorithms. And in all the ways we test and refine our business, they will partner to design data schemas and performance metrics that provide the views we need to steer our business. Experience with the auto industry or knowledge of cars is a plus but not required.We're looking for someone who will: Develop a deep understanding of specific areas of the business and the key metrics that drive performance. Query data to analyze, monitor, and investigate trendsStructure complex and sometimes ambiguous business issues and develop compelling, insightful recommendationsUse statistics to analyze experiments and build models for use in pricing, marketing, or logisticsManage key performance indicators (KPIs), automate reporting wherever possiblePerform extensive data QA. Troubleshoot issues and work cross-functionally towards a solutionThe ideal candidate will have:A love for learning and personal developmentB.A./B.S. or equivalent degree with 1-4 years of analytics and statistics experienceBasic to intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python, and RComfort with both qualitative and quantitative analysis. Passion for delivering actionable insightsAbility to execute a project from start to finish with independence, resourcefulness, and creative thinkingExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAn ability to work well with people - both on our team, with partners, and customersOn diversityOur company depends on balance and equality between buyers and sellers, among employees, and in our relationships with customers.Our mission to evolve car ownership and transform an industry is a challenging one. It can only be achieved by a team of diverse problem-solvers engineers, designers, business people from the same broad demographics as our customers.Why join now?Weve built a small but highly talented team backed by $120 million in funding from investors like DFJ, Goldman Sachs, and BMW iVentures. Weve got product-market fit, but theres still a ton of room to innovate and make your mark on the product and on the company.Shift is the Bay Areas #1 seller of used cars with $100 million in cars sold per year. Were serving most of California and are gearing up to scale to new markets. With a solid business model and no clear winner in our space yet, this is a hugely exciting time to join the team.
